bill_title: Supporting the right to pray in public schools.

bill_versions.bill_text: A CONCURRENT RESOLUTION, Supporting the right to pray in public schools. WHEREAS, the founding of this country is rooted in the belief that all men and women are endowed with the right to follow their conscience, to worship freely, and to live in accordance with their convictions; and WHEREAS, religious freedom is this country's first freedom and has, throughout history, been a driving force behind many of the most defining moments of our identity as a country; and WHEREAS, the First Amendment to the United States Constitution clearly articulates the intention of our founders to prevent governmental interference in the practice of religion; and WHEREAS, in May 2017, President Donald J. Trump signed an Executive Order to advance religious liberty for individuals and institutions; and WHEREAS, our ability to worship freely and openly and to live within our faith should never be infringed; and WHEREAS, repressive governments around the world persecute Christians and other religious worshipers, and terrorist organizations carry out barbaric violence against innocent victims because of their religion; and WHEREAS, this country seeks to dispel religious persecution and discrimination around the world and to ensure respect for the freedom of religion and religious beliefs; and WHEREAS, our founding fathers entrusted the people with the solemn responsibility of protecting religious liberty so that we, as a people and as a nation, may always stand as a guiding beacon for the world: NOW, THEREFORE, BE IT RESOLVED, by the House of Representatives of the Ninety-Fifth Legislature of the State of South Dakota, the Senate concurring therein, that the Legislature supports the United States Department of Education’s guidance entitled "Constitutionally Protected Prayer and Religious Expression in Public Elementary and Secondary Schools," dated January 16, 2020; and BE IT FURTHER RESOLVED, that the secretary of the Senate provide copies of this resolution to the speaker and clerk of the United States House of Representatives, to the president pro tempore and the secretary of the United States Senate, and to the members of the South Dakota congressional delegation.

A CONCURRENT RESOLUTION, Supporting the right to pray in public schools. WHEREAS, our founders approved the First Amendment of the United States Constitution that made religious freedom the initial right stated in our foundational document; and WHEREAS, the First Amendment of the United States Constitution articulates the intention of our founders to prevent governmental interference in the practice of religion; and WHEREAS, the ability of people to worship freely and openly and to live faithfully by the tenets of their faith is protected by the First Amendment; and WHEREAS, repressive governments around the world persecute Christians and other religious worshipers, and terrorist organizations carry out barbaric violence against innocent people because of their religion; and WHEREAS, the United States desires the end of religious persecution around the world and desires to ensure respect for the freedom of religion; and WHEREAS, in May 2017, President Donald J. Trump signed an Executive Order to advance religious liberty for individuals and institutions: NOW, THEREFORE, BE IT RESOLVED, by the House of Representatives of the Ninety-Fifth Legislature of the State of South Dakota, the Senate concurring therein, that the Legislature supports the United States Department of Education’s guidance entitled "Constitutionally Protected Prayer and Religious Expression in Public Elementary and Secondary Schools," dated January 16, 2020; and BE IT FURTHER RESOLVED, that the clerk of the House of Representatives provide copies of this resolution to the speaker and clerk of the United States House of Representatives, to the president pro tempore and the secretary of the United States Senate, and to the members of the South Dakota congressional delegation.

A CONCURRENT RESOLUTION, Supporting the right to pray in public schools. WHEREAS, our founders approved the First Amendment of the United States Constitution that made religious freedom the initial right stated in our foundational document; and WHEREAS, the First Amendment of the United States Constitution articulates the intention of our founders to prevent governmental interference in the practice of religion; and WHEREAS, the ability of people to worship freely and openly and to live faithfully by the tenets of their faith is protected by the First Amendment; and WHEREAS, a major part of many world religions is the practice of prayer both private and public; and WHEREAS, in the case of Engel v. Vitale, 1962, the Supreme Court of the United States ruled that state-sponsored prayers in public schools violated the First Amendment of the United States Constitution; and WHEREAS, prayer by individual students can be accomplished in public schools in a voluntary, nondisruptive manner, consistent with court rulings on the subject of prayer in public schools; and WHEREAS, in recent months, the administration of President Donald J. Trump has issued new guidelines through the United States Department of Education regarding this issue: NOW, THEREFORE, BE IT RESOLVED, by the House of Representatives of the Ninety-Fifth Legislature of the State of South Dakota, the Senate concurring therein, that the Legislature supports the United States Department of Education's guidance entitled "Constitutionally Protected Prayer and Religious Expression in Public Elementary and Secondary Schools," dated January 16, 2020; and BE IT FURTHER RESOLVED, that the clerk of the House of Representatives provide copies of this resolution to the speaker and clerk of the United States House of Representatives, to the president pro tempore and the secretary of the United States Senate, and to the members of the South Dakota congressional delegation.
